intro: Lagarinthus brevicuspis, commonly known as the short-spined morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant blue or violet flowers that bloom in the morning, hence its common name. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are hairy and twining. Lagarinthus brevicuspis is often found in moist, wooded areas and is valued for its ornamental beauty.
